reviewText:
Perry Mason, Volume 9 Collector's Edition DVD

The `Perry Mason' show lasted for nine seasons, a record then. Out of its 271 episodes 120 were used for sixty VHS tapes published around 1994. Later 108 of these were used for twenty-seven DVD discs in four volumes. In 2006 they started to release the whole series on DVDs, a half-season at a time. The First Season was the best as most of its stories came from Gardner's novels. A [year] identifies the original novel.

"The Case of the Mystified Miner" begins on a Saturday morning. Miss Amelia Corning will arrive from South America to inspect the records of her holdings. Mr. Endicott Campbell is her business manager. Young Carleton has a shoe-box from his father's closet. Miss Susan Fisher is surprised by its contents. She gets a telephone call from a person who arrived a day early. "I am the Corning Company." Susan contacts Perry Mason for advice. She didn't count the money with a witness, she could be accused by the owner of that shoe-box! Was that mine abandoned? Susan needs a lawyer. They are surprised to learn that Amelia Corning has vanished with the company files. Was there an impersonation? Paul Drake investigates the Monarch Mine's finances. Was Susan set up by hiring that rental car? Who killed the mine foreman? "How many prints?" The witnesses testify at the hearing. Is someone lying? How did the fingerprints get on the car? The testimony of a hotel maid seems incriminating. Perry points out the trick of getting a person to identify a suspect for the police. Will Paul Drake find new evidence that will lead to the missing woman and a solution to the mystery? The last scene ties up the loose ends and ends in humor. [This story echoes "The Case of the Spurious Spinster" [1961].]

"The Case of the Mythical Monkeys" [1959] begins on a dark and stormy night. Gladys Doyle was supposed to pick up a package but got lost and her car was stuck. A man lets her into a cabin, then disappears. Gladys later finds a body on the floor of the other bedroom. She tells her friend what happened, then they visit Perry Mason. Paul Drake investigates. Mauvis Meade, the author, has a friend who is connected to the underworld. The police take Gladys in for the murder. A strange man visits Perry Mason and leaves a map. Perry and Paul investigate. Items belonging to Gladys were found in that cabin. Who rented that cabin? Who put that scarf in that coffee can? Who made that telephone call? Did Mauvis know more than she can tell? Will a witness tell things that will reveal the real killer and free Perry's client? [The original story is better than this condensed version.]

"The Case of the Bogus Books" begins on a rainy night at a book store. Ellen Carter's brother visits to borrow money fro his gambling debts. Did he steal something? Was that book "hot"? The scam is explained to the viewers. Pete Norland takes Ellen to see Perry Mason who starts an investigation. Ellen gets her job back. But Mr. Kraft will speak no more. Was it an accident? Does Perry have a library card? The film shows how rare books are stolen from libraries. Perry believes Ellen, but will the police? Lt. Tragg arrests Ellen for the murder. Perry figures out when the murder was done by the action of the flies! Then witnesses are recalled to answer questions. Will one witness reveal a fact that will free Perry's client? The last scene ties up the loose ends. [The credits tell why one brand of automobiles is featured in this story.]
